Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Neoadjuvant GAP Therapy in Resectable High-Risk Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma

Trial_Design.evidence: A multi-institutional, single-arm, phase II trial was conducted.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility included tumor size >5 cm, multiple tumors, major vascular invasion, or lymph node involvement.

Intervention.evidence: Patients received preoperative GAP (gemcitabine 800 mg/m², cisplatin 25 mg/m², nab-paclitaxel 100 mg/m² on days 1 and 8 of a 21-day cycle) for 4 cycles before curative-intent resection.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the feasibility of neoadjuvant gemcitabine, cisplatin, and nab-paclitaxel (GAP) in resectable, high-risk IHCC.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was completion of chemotherapy and surgery.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Twenty-two patients (73%, 90% CI 57–86; p=0.008) completed chemotherapy and surgery.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Disease control rate was 90% (progressive disease: 10%, partial response: 23%, stable disease: 67%).

Harms.evidence: Ten patients (33%) experienced grade ≥3 adverse events, mainly neutropenia and diarrhea; 50% required dose reduction.
